required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity and Safety of Sabin-IPV Replacement Vaccination
clinical_study.official_title: a Randomized, Controlled Clinical Trial of Immunogenicity and Safety of Sabin-based Inactivated Polio Vaccine Replacing Salk-based Inactivated Polio Vaccine

lead_sponsor.agency: China National Biotec Group Company Limited

collaborator.agency: Beijing Institute of Biological Products Co Ltd.
Beijing Center for Disease Control and Prevention

clinical_study.source: China National Biotec Group Company Limited

brief_summary.textblock: This study replaced the 2nd and 3rd dose of Salk-IPV (produced by Sanofi) with Sabin-IPV (produced by CNBG) and then reviewed the safety and immunogenicity of the vaccination, aiming to acquire scientific evidence for the feasibility of immunization involving different viral strains replacement.

detailed_description.textblock:
It is required by China Food and Drug Administration (CFDA) that considering in the real situation IPV receivers may be immuned by different viral strains of this vaccine, a phase 4 clinical trial aiming to demonstrate the safety and immunogenicity of the immunization schedule should be carried out. To be specific, the subjects were divided into 2 groups.
Group 1 received Salk-IPV+Sabin-IPV+Sabin-IPV respectively at the age of 2,3,4 months old.
Group 2 received Salk-IPV+Salk-IPV+Salk-IPV respectively at the age of 2,3,4 months old.
Blood sample was collected before vaccination and 30 days after the third dose of vaccination. Neutralization antibody against type I, Type II and Type III poliomyelitis virus were detected to evaluate the seroprotection rates and antibody geometric mean concentrations. The safety of both immunization schedule will also been monitored.

primary_outcome.description: determine the seroconversion rate of both groups

secondary_outcome.description: Measure neutralizing antibody titers against poliovirus type I, II and III

other_outcome.measure: number of participants who experience adverse events
other_outcome.description: analyse the number and rate of vaccine participants who have adverse events following immunization

arm_group.description: 180 2-month-old subjects will be enrolled with vaccination schedule as follows: 1st: Salk-IPV; 2nd: Sabin-IPV; 3rd: Sabin-IPV
180 2-month-old subjects will be enrolled with vaccination schedule as follows: 1st: Salk-IPV; 2nd: Salk-IPV; 3rd: Salk-IPV

intervention.description: Inactivated Polio Vaccine at age of 2,3,4 months old, respectively

overall_official.affiliation: Beijing Center for Disease Control and Prevention

facility.name: Beijing Center for Disease Control and Prevention
